intro: Hieracium viriduliceps, commonly known as the green-headed hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads made up of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, with erect, hairy stems and basal leaves that are lance-shaped and serrated. Its flowers are yellow, arranged in a single head, and bloom from late spring to early autumn. Hieracium viriduliceps is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, and it is known for its aggressive growth habit.
